Unadjusted Langevin Algorithm to approximate a normal distribution

```{r}
N <- 100000 # number of steps of the Markov chain
delta <- 1 # step size
X <- numeric(N) # create Markov chain
mu <- -20 # setting the parameters of the distribution we want to approximate
sigma <- 5
X[1] <- 0 # set initial state of Markov chain
for(n in 1:(N-1)){
 X[n+1] <- X[n] + delta/2*(-(X[n]-mu)/sigma^2) + sqrt(delta)*rnorm(1) # update chain
}
hist(X, freq = FALSE) # histogram of Markov chain and adding desired normal density
curve(1/sqrt(2*pi*sigma^2)*exp(-(x-mu)^2/(2*sigma^2)), add = TRUE) 
```
